quotes.quote: Librarians are generals in the war on ignorance.
Librarians lend people books from the library. The best librarians are children's book librarians.
Not all librarians are evil cultists. Some librarians are instead vengeful undead who want to suck your soul.
Librarians as a race tend to be tedious.
The Librarian liked being best man. You were allowed to kiss bridesmaids, and they weren't allowed to run away.
Librarians save lives: by handing the right book, at the right time, to a kid in need.
Google can bring you back 100,000 answers. A librarian can bring you back the right one.
Librarians are tour-guides for all of knowledge.
Information is valuable. Librarians and libraries are, at best incidental; at worst, in the way.
In general, librarians enjoyed special requests. A reference librarian is someone who likes the chase. When librarians read for pleasure, they often pick a good mystery.
Librarians are the secret masters of the world. They control information. Don't ever piss one off.
Librarians consider free access to information the foundation of democracy.
Love with librarians mean love with books.

Good librarians are natural intelligence operatives. They possess all of the skills and characteristics required for that work: curiosity, wide-ranging knowledge, good memories, organization and analytical aptitude, and discretion.
Bad libraries build collections, good libraries build services, great libraries build communities.
Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers.
To be a librarian is not to be neutral, or passive, or waiting for a question. It is to be a radical positive change agent within your community.
The librarian must be the librarian militant before he can be the librarian triumphant.

The librarian isn't a clerk who happens to work in a library. A librarian is a data hound, a guide, a sherpa and a teacher. The librarian is the interface between reams of data and the untrained but motivated user.
Librarians are on the front lines of an invisible struggle over our information diet and, for better or worse, the scales are not tipping in their direction.
When the going gets tough, the tough get a librarian.
It is an awfully sad misconception that librarians simply check books in and out. The library is the heart of a school, and without a librarian, it is but an empty shell.
You can take the girl out of the library, but you can't take the neurotic, compulsively curious librarian out of the girl.
Librarians have always been among the most thoughtful and helpful people. They are teachers without a classroom.
Librarians are almost always very helpful and often almost absurdly knowledgeable. Their skills are probably very underestimated and largely underemployed.
Don't mark up the Library's copy, you fool! Librarians are Unprankable. They'll track you down! They have skills!
Librarian is a service occupation. Gas station attendant of the mind.
The most important asset of any library goes home at night â€“ the library staff.
We need librarians who can handle this tremendous jumble of information that is in cyberspace.
Never argue with a librarian; they know too much.
